content: issue 6 feb 2019 rainfall shawl knitting pattern by jo creates this super-simple knitted shawl looks effective in any variegated yarn knitted using stripes of garter and stockinette stitch with sections of eyelets this asymmetrical triangle shawl is simple to knit and easily adjusted with two size options given www jo-creates com © joanna hardy 2018 all rights reserved you may not reproduce or sell this pattern in any form suggested yarn 480-900m koigu kpppm or any other fingering- weight yarn pattern is shown in koigu kpppm colour 146 other notions tapestry needle for weaving in ends needle size 3 5mm gauge gauge isn t terribly important for this shawl but if you want to check 24sts x 15 row in 10cm in stockinette finished size 110cm x 128cm smaller size 137 x 192 larger size suitable for advanced beginner worked flat casting on use the long-tail cast-on method abbreviations  knit k  knit front and back kfb  knit two together k2tog  purl p  purl front and back pfb  yarn over yo this pattern is made up from a very simple set of repeating sections or garter stockinette and eyelets i ve described how to make each section and then how to use these sections to make the shawl and stitch counts etc special note on the eyelet section i know that it is really easy to accidentally miss a kfb or pfb in these patterns and i wouldn t want you to worry when you got to the eyelet section that you had to rip back to find the mistake the most important thing is that you have an odd number of stitches remaining on the needle when you start that section if you get there and find that you are short a stitch or two or have an extra stitch or two don t panic just go one more or one less with the first knit stitches so that you always have an odd number of stitches left you won t notice one stitch more or less to help you stay on-track i ve put stitch counts at the end of each section www jo-creates com © joanna hardy 2018 all rights reserved you may not reproduce or sell this pattern in any form garter section row g1 kfb k to end row g2 k to last stitch then kfb in that last stitch row g3 to g16 repeat row g1 and g2 7 more times 8 times total stockinette section a row sa1 pfb p to end row sa2 k to last stitch kfb in that last stitch row sa3 to sa5 repeat row sa1 and sa2 once then do row s1 a third time eyelet section note this section is repeated a number of times but the number of k stitches on each row shown by the x will vary see pattern below for details of how many stitches to do on each row row e1 k x stitches then *yo
